alert.note: Alert for Central and Southern Scott County; Northern Polk County Higher Elevations; Northern Scott County; Northwest Yell County; Southern Johnson County; Southern Pope County; Southern and Eastern Logan County; Western and Northern Logan County (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 05 at 7:46AM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Logan, southwestern Johnson, Scott, northwestern Polk, northwestern Yell and west central Pope Counties through 815 AM CDT... At 746 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Fort Chaffee to near Oliver to 6 miles east of Heavener Runestone State Park to near Muse. Movement was east at 90 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Booneville... Waldron... Paris... Lamar... Mansfield... Magazine... Knoxville... Subiaco... Scranton... Ratcliff... Blue Mountain... Beauchamp... Cardiff... Mountain Fork... Midway in Logan County... Stonehouse Recreation Area... Mount Magazine... Oliver... Echo... Morgan Springs... MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until noon CDT for western and central Arkansas.
